parents.mother: from Rennegoutte in val de Champ

confession.devil_appearance: like a man, dressed in yellow
confession.seduction_context: After quarrel with late Demenge Babel, figure came to his house and suggested he should avenge himself. Offered to make him rich if he would believe in him and renounce God
sabbat_activities: dancing to sound of flute and violins
eating beef and mutton (good but unsalted)

timeline.subject: procureur for canons
timeline.details: procureur for canons has received denunciation; asks for witnesses to be heard, followed if appropriate by arrest, interrogation, and confrontations

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: First interrogation, made voluntary confession of seduction by Persin and some malefices

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, denied most charges, then offered to make full confession; confessed to sabbat attendance and additional malefices

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: que l'on ne scauroit rien dire de luy, qu'il ne le scache a la fin
notable_quotes.english: that one cannot say anything about him that he will not know in the end
notable_quotes.context: Witness 5 heard him say this on many occasions, suspected this must be through agency of devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: que quant lesdits veaux auroient sucez le laict, le diable les emporteroit
notable_quotes.english: that when the calves had sucked the milk, the devil would carry them away
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Demenge Babel after refusing to sell calves

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: il deviendroit bien tost her, ou grand seigneur
notable_quotes.english: he would soon become heir, or great lord
notable_quotes.context: Said to Claudon Renouard's husband about doing carting work

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: que le diable puisse rompre le col et les jambes des chevaulx, et des servans et servantes
notable_quotes.english: may the devil break the neck and legs of the horses, and of the servants male and female
notable_quotes.context: Curse after mare knocked him down

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.context: When asked why he did not seek reparation for being called witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y avoit bien quelques choses qu'on ne scavoit et qui pouvoit arriver, qu'il craindoit
notable_quotes.english: that there were some things that one did not know and that could happen, that he feared
notable_quotes.context: When asked why he wanted to make donation of goods

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y avoit bien quelque chose
notable_quotes.context: When maire Jean Simonin told him he suspected him of being a witch

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over renting land, carting work, damage by animals, and payment for goods (pigs). Jean rented land and meadows to others. He owned property and engaged in agricultural work as a manouvrier. Several quarrels involved economic transactions gone wrong or resentment over others' economic success.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial features voluntary confession without torture. Accused showed signs of suicidal ideation and eventually confessed to seduction by devil named Persin, receiving magical powders, attending sabbat, and causing harm to animals and one human death. Named 4 accomplices at sabbat. 24 witnesses testified to long reputation (up to 20 years), multiple quarrels over economic matters, and alleged harms primarily to livestock. Change de Nancy approved death sentence which was carried out 10 days later.
